God of WisdomUpdated on 03 Jul 2019It is a Regular Savings Plan (“RSP”) that allows you to invest via a GIRO arrangement on a monthly basis. You can choose either invest in the Nikko AM Singapore STI ETF, or the ABF Singapore Bond Fund, from a minimum of $100/mth. Units will be bought in on a regular basis for you. Do consider your risk appetite, your investment horizon, as well as the costs of investing.More information is available here, and you should take some time read them before deciding if this is for you:https://www.posb.com.sg/personal/investments/investing-in-funds/invest-saver3 comments4

Thanks in advanceElijah Lee03 Jul 2019I personally don't do RSP this way, but if you want to set aside a monthly amount, please note the cost of investing (i.e. how much of your monthly amount is going to costs and fees). Keep it low (<1% is a good gauge)and also the amount should not be a significant portion of your free cash flow.

Lastly, SSBs are guaranteed. So they cannot be compared to investments.
